item.title: About
item.description: About Me I received B.S. degree from Anhui University in 2009. Then, I studied the statistical physics as applied to complex networks and complex systems at University of Science and Technology of China, and received Ph.D. degree in 2014. From 2014 to 2016, I was a Post-doctoral Fellower in the Department of Modern Physics at University of Science and Technology of China. In the first half of 2016, I worked at Department of Applied Physics, The Hong Kong Polytechnic University as a Post-doctoral Fellower.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Since 2011, I have published 55 papers in collaboration with others in peer-reviewed journals. These publications include: Physics Reports (1), Physical Review Letters (1), National Science Review (1), Physical Review Research (2), Physical Review E (5), New Journal of Physics (2), Journal of Statistical Mechanics (4), Chaos (1), Chaos, Solitons & Fractals (3), Europhysics Letters (3), Physics Letters A (1), PLoS ONE (1), Scientific Reports (3), Physica A (8), Chinese Physics Letters (1), Chinese Physics B (5), Advances in Complex Systems (1), International Journal of Modern Physics C (2), Computer Networks (1), IEEE Transactions (1), conference proceedings (4), and journals in Chinese (4).

item.title: Research
item.description: Statistical Physics and Complex Systems My research lies at the intersection of statistical physics and complex systems, where I investigate the emergent behavior of interacting systems through the lens of phase transitions and critical phenomena. By leveraging analytical and computational tools, I aim to uncover universal principles governing the collective dynamics of systems ranging from simple lattice models to intricate real-world networks. Phase Transitions and Critical Phenomena Phase transitions, where a system undergoes a qualitative change in its macroscopic properties, are a central theme in statistical physics.

item.title: 中文
item.description: 基本情况 李明，博士，研究员/黄山学者特聘教授，合肥工业大学物理学院物理系。 研究领域（理论研究）: 统计物理与复杂系统。近期主要研究兴趣: 临界行为的动态分析方法、高维逾渗相变、随机游走、沙堆模型等。主要研究成果请见Publications或者谷歌学术。 招生情况 如果你在统计物理、计算物理、编程模拟、数学等一方面或多方面有所擅长，希望利用这些知识做些有趣的研究，或在科研中深入学习相关知识，欢迎加入我们（研究生、本科生均可）。交流沟通请发邮件至：lim@hfut.edu.cn。
